manpage.volume: Category Smart Pointer Class Shared Method

description.para: Creates Category category object and makes corresponding category smart pointer points to this object. This method has two forms, as the following:

param_note.para: Relative location of object with client. There are five possible values, as the following:

tr.td: Object and client are located in the same address space
Object and client are located in different address spaces, but they are located in the same process
Object and client are located in different address spaces and object runs in the kernel
Object and client are located in different process spaces, but they are located in the same machine
Object and client are located in different machines

param_note.para: For details please see executable code run-time environment (context).

return.para: The return value of this method has the following situations:

tr.td: Interface pointer in specified class did not completely successfully obtained
All interface pointers are not successfully obtained in specified class

remarks.para: When user does not care the relative location of created object and client, the first method is selected. No parameter is needed when invoking Instantiate method. System default value is one of the three values CTX_SAME_DOMAIN, CTX_DIFF_DOMAIN and CTX_DIFF_PROCESS. Relative location of created object and client is determind by priority.
When user need to specify relative location of created object and client, the second method is selected. Corresponding parameter need to be set when invoking Instantiate method.
Note:If the user wants to create file system object, the second method is selecte and parameter dwClsContext must be set to CTX_KERN_DOMAIN.
